intro: Sophora korolkowii, commonly known as the Chinese槐 or the false acacia, is a deciduous leguminous tree native to China. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are pinnately arranged and have a feathery appearance. The tree produces yellowish-white flowers in clusters, which bloom in the spring and are followed by elongated pods containing flat, dark seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine. The plant has a shallow root system and is adaptable to a variety of soil types.
